html: Repentance comes too late to avoid catastrophe for this fraternal people. Now they must endure the hardships of that evil time as a consequence of wickedness until their iniquities are purged. Still, those who love all of God’s children loathe to see others suffer and are profoundly moved at Moab’s belated penitence (Isaiah 15:2-3). They know that Jehovah readily hears those who love him, whose hearts are right with him: “O people of Zion, O inhabitants of Jerusalem, you shall have no cause to weep. He will graciously respond at the cry of your voice; he will answer you as soon as he hears it” (Isaiah 30:19).
